entries.title: Alchemy Integrative Wellness
entries.highlights: WordPress, PHP, graphic design, HTML5, CSS3, Responsive, Mobile First Design, newsletter
entries.content:
Chrysta Faye wanted a modern website that she could manage. A top priority, of course, was that her new site be responsive and stramlined for mobile use.

Since Chrysta has experience managing a WordPress website, we chose the ubiquitous content management system(CMS) upon which to build the site.Another priority was a call to action for newsletter subscriptions.We decided on a two - column design, with a large header to feature artwork to complement her alchemical aesthetic.

Initial wireframing was done with ultra - high - tech pencil and graph paper. In my process, an eraser (and Ctrl + Z) is essential. I also like how it presents the wireframe as a sketch that can be easily edited.

Once the design was approved, I took the twenty - sixteen starter theme and massaged it into shape. In my opinion, we might as well have the folks at WordPress.org performin security updates for us, so Chrysta's site is a child-theme of the current default WordPress theme. It might be a bit more work than using pre-built themes more similar to our goal, but, since WordPress is the most commonly-used CMS on the web it gets targeted by all sorts of nefarious actors.

The mandala background image and logo was created by Kat V.L.Wright, who is an incredible designer and illustrator, and also happens to be my wife.
entries.testimonial: What an amazing job Paul did!  - Presumably what Chrysta will say when she writes me a testimonial.
